content.prompt: Which of the following was a major United States foreign policy change in the Pacific region at the end of the nineteenth century?

choices.label: The United States began to accept unrestricted immigration from East Asia.
The United States supported the formation of the Kingdom of Hawaii.
The United States reduced the size of its navy through international agreements.
The United States acquired new colonial possessions such as the Philippines.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
